medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed nasal congestion and rhinorrhea 1 week before presentation. He ingested 2 tablets of an over-the-counter cold remedy containing pseudoephedrine and developed severe substernal chest pain 45 minutes later while at rest. The chest pain was dull and nonradiating, associated with shortness of breath and diaphoresis. He attempted to relieve the pain with bismuth subsalicylate but had no relief. He presented to the ED 30 minutes after the onset of pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had no history of heart disease, diabetes, hypertension, or dyslipidemia. He reported one previous episode of similar chest pain one week before, also after taking the same cold remedy, which was less severe and resolved spontaneously.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of coronary artery disease or sudden death.
medical_history.social_history: The patient denied tobacco or cocaine use. He reported no allergies to medications.
